Today @HouseJudiciary held the first hearing on gun violence in nearly a decade.

I shared the story of my son, Jordan, a victim of gun violence.

Our stories are vitally important as we work to pass common-sense legislation to #EndGunViolence.

Congress finally is #TakingAction. https://t.co/tz6SdGQiid

You are a miserable excuse for representation.  I was there today.  My daughter was killed by an American male.  Your nonsense, has nothing to do with the majority of 40,000 gun deaths per year.  Glad today's hearing provided sunshine on who you are. https://t.co/NK4huvMIkK

A sitting member of Congress today at hearing on gun violence went on for 8 minutes on The Wall.

At a gun violence hearing.
He talked about a Wall.

Know how ridiculous that sounds?

That be like if you had a hearing about Gun Violence and some idiot started talking about a wall

Two Parkland fathers, Manuel Oliver and Fred Guttenberg, were seated in the audience. Oliver, who lost his son Joaquin in the shooting, stood up and protested Gaetz’s remarks; Guttenberg, whose daughter Jaime was killed, also spoke out.

Arguing more guns in more places will make us safer goes against everything that is true. We are the only developed nation that has even close to this many gun deaths and injuries. I'm sad young people have been sold lies/don't understand less weapons of mass murder=less murder.
